alert.note: Alert for Furnas; Harlan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 2:24AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Furnas and southwestern Harlan Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 223 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Hendley, or 13 miles north of Norton, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and mainly hail up to one half inch, although slightly larger is possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oxford, Beaver City, Orleans, Stamford, Hendley and Hollinger. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
